description: A man and woman are seated at a table, mid-meal, in what appears to be a historical setting with swords and a shield displayed. The woman, with striking red hair, is admonishing the man, dressed in puffy sleeves and large boots, to be more assertive. Her frustration stems from others referring to him as "Alexander the Pretty-Good." This title is an absurdly mundane descriptor in contrast to the implied potential for significant achievement suggested by the setting and name, highlighting the irony of domestic mediocrity clashing with aspirations of greatness.
caption: "And another thing! ... I want you to be more assertive! I'm tired of everyone calling you Alexander the Pretty-Good!"
